subject: AArch64 build fix
commitMessage:
AArch64 build fix

Tizen toolchain team in Samsung company is planning to build Tizen
for new arm 64 bit architecture - Aarch64. But package "ug-myfile-efl"
cannot be built for this architecture because of build errors.

src/include/mf-ug-main.h:27:20: fatal error: Ethumb.h: No such file or directory
So, just a pkg-config dependency added

Change-Id: I9d74b9e5dba1baf01d38de53b39b69a89eb50855
Signed-off-by: Vyacheslav Barinov <v.barinov@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

This change fixes build for armv7l, i586, aarch64. Build results: not patched: https://build.tizen.org/package/show?package=ug-myfile-efl-fail&project=devel%3Aarm_toolchain%3AMobile%3Atest  patched: https://build.tizen.org/package/show?package=ug-myfile-efl&project=devel%3Aarm_toolchain%3AMobile%3Atest

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Had been waiting for enough time (1 month) without any negative feedback. Force merge to fix the build fail.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
